External Partnership Guidelines

Comprehensive guide for external partners working with Malaika House to ensure safe, effective, and compliant club operations

Last updated: September 2025 | Version 3.2

🤝

Partnership Overview

Our Collaboration Model

Malaika House partners with external organizations to extend our reach and provide specialized support services to neurodivergent individuals and their families. Our partnership model is built on shared values, mutual respect, and a commitment to excellence in service delivery.

Core Partnership Principles

  • Person-Centered Approach: All activities must prioritize the individual needs, preferences, and dignity of participants
  • Inclusive Practice: Programs should be accessible and welcoming to all participants regardless of their support needs
  • Evidence-Based Methods: Activities should be grounded in current best practices for neurodivergent support
  • Collaborative Decision-Making: Regular consultation with Malaika House staff on program development and participant welfare
  • Continuous Improvement: Commitment to ongoing evaluation and enhancement of services
🎯 Partnership Objectives

Together, we aim to create supportive environments where neurodivergent individuals can develop skills, build relationships, and participate meaningfully in their communities. Our external partnerships expand capacity while maintaining the high standards of care and professionalism that define Malaika House.

Roles and Responsibilities

External Partner Responsibilities

  • Provide qualified, trained facilitators for all club sessions
  • Maintain appropriate insurance coverage and risk management procedures
  • Follow all Malaika House policies and procedures
  • Participate in regular supervision and support meetings
  • Complete required training and professional development
  • Maintain accurate records and submit reports as required

Malaika House Responsibilities

  • Provide initial and ongoing training for partner organizations
  • Offer supervision, support, and consultation services
  • Maintain oversight of participant welfare and program quality
  • Handle participant referrals and intake processes
  • Provide access to resources, materials, and professional networks
  • Manage communication with families and other stakeholders
🛡️

Safeguarding Policies

⚠️ Critical Requirement

All external partners must complete Malaika House safeguarding training before beginning work with participants. This is a non-negotiable requirement for all partnership agreements.

Child Protection Standards

External partners working with minors must adhere to the highest standards of child protection, including:

  • Background Checks: All staff must have current criminal background checks and working with children clearances
  • Supervision Requirements: Minimum staff-to-participant ratios must be maintained at all times
  • Physical Safety: Venues must meet safety standards with appropriate emergency exits and first aid equipment
  • Behavioral Guidelines: Clear protocols for managing challenging behaviors without use of physical restraint
  • Mandatory Reporting: All staff must understand and comply with mandatory reporting obligations

Adult Safeguarding

For adult participants, safeguarding measures include:

  • Respect for participant autonomy and decision-making capacity
  • Recognition and response to signs of abuse or neglect
  • Support for participants to understand their rights
  • Appropriate boundaries in professional relationships

Incident Management

Immediate Response Protocol

  • Ensure immediate safety of all participants
  • Provide necessary medical attention if required
  • Document the incident thoroughly and objectively
  • Notify Malaika House within 2 hours of any serious incident
  • Complete formal incident report within 24 hours
🚨 Emergency Contact

For immediate safeguarding concerns, contact the Malaika House Safeguarding Officer directly: Emergency Line: 1800-MALAIKA

⚙️

Operational Standards

Session Planning and Preparation

All club sessions must be planned in advance using Malaika House approved templates and methodologies:

Pre-Session Requirements

  • Complete session plan submitted 48 hours in advance
  • Risk assessment completed for all activities
  • Materials and resources prepared and safety-checked
  • Participant needs review completed
  • Backup activities prepared for flexibility

During Sessions

Facilitator Standards

  • Professional Behavior: Maintain appropriate boundaries and professional conduct at all times
  • Inclusive Facilitation: Ensure all participants can engage meaningfully in activities
  • Positive Reinforcement: Use strength-based approaches and celebrate achievements
  • Individual Support: Provide personalized assistance while encouraging independence
  • Crisis Prevention: Use de-escalation techniques and environmental modifications to prevent challenging situations

Documentation Requirements

  • Attendance records for all sessions
  • Brief progress notes for each participant
  • Incident reports for any unusual occurrences
  • Monthly summary reports submitted to Malaika House
  • Feedback forms from participants and families
📈 Quality Assurance

Malaika House conducts regular quality assurance visits and may observe sessions to ensure standards are maintained. Partners will receive advance notice and feedback to support continuous improvement.

Venue and Equipment Standards

  • Accessible venues with appropriate facilities for all participants
  • Adequate space for activities and safe movement
  • Proper lighting, temperature control, and ventilation
  • Safety equipment including first aid kits and emergency procedures
  • Age-appropriate and safe materials and equipment
💬

Communication Protocols

With Participants

  • Use respectful, person-first language at all times
  • Communicate in clear, accessible language appropriate to each individual's needs
  • Listen actively and validate participant perspectives and experiences
  • Provide choices and respect participant decisions wherever possible
  • Use visual supports, social stories, or other communication aids as needed
  • Maintain confidentiality - participant information should not be shared outside the session

With Families and Caregivers

⚠️ Important Protocol

All communication with families must be coordinated through Malaika House. External partners should not initiate direct contact with families without prior approval.

  • Refer all family inquiries to Malaika House staff
  • Participate in family meetings when requested by Malaika House
  • Provide input for family communication through proper channels
  • Respect family privacy and cultural considerations

With Malaika House Team

  • Attend monthly supervision meetings as scheduled
  • Report concerns or significant changes immediately
  • Seek guidance when unsure about appropriate responses
  • Participate constructively in case reviews and planning
  • Submit required documentation on time

Professional Boundaries

  • Maintain professional relationships with all participants
  • Do not exchange personal contact information
  • Avoid dual relationships or conflicts of interest
  • Respect cultural and religious differences
  • Maintain appropriate physical boundaries
🔒

Data Privacy & Confidentiality

⚠️ Legal Requirement

All external partners must sign confidentiality agreements and comply with privacy legislation including the Privacy Act and relevant state-based requirements.

Information Management

  • Participant Information: Only collect information necessary for program delivery
  • Secure Storage: All records must be stored securely with appropriate access controls
  • Limited Access: Information should only be accessed by authorized personnel
  • No Sharing: Participant information cannot be shared with third parties without consent
  • Retention Limits: Records must be disposed of according to specified timeframes

Photography and Social Media

  • Written consent required for any photographs or recordings
  • No posting of participant images on social media
  • Marketing materials require specific consent and Malaika House approval
  • Participants have the right to withdraw consent at any time

Technology and Digital Security

  • Use secure, password-protected devices for any digital records
  • Do not use personal devices or accounts for participant information
  • Regular software updates and security patches required
  • Report any data breaches immediately to Malaika House
🛡️ Data Protection

Remember: Participants trust us with sensitive information about their lives, challenges, and goals. Protecting this trust through rigorous confidentiality practices is both a legal requirement and an ethical obligation.

🚨

Emergency Procedures

Medical Emergencies

Immediate Response

  • Life-threatening situations: Call 000 immediately
  • Assess the situation: Ensure scene safety before providing assistance
  • Provide first aid: Only within your level of training and competence
  • Contact emergency contacts: Notify families and Malaika House immediately
  • Document thoroughly: Record all details of the incident and response

Behavioral Crises

  • Implement de-escalation techniques learned in training
  • Ensure safety of all participants and staff
  • Remove triggers from the environment if possible
  • Use calm, reassuring communication
  • Contact Malaika House for guidance if situation escalates
⚠️ Prohibited Actions

External partners must NEVER use physical restraint, isolation, or any form of punishment. If a situation cannot be safely managed through de-escalation, contact emergency services and Malaika House immediately.

Evacuation Procedures

  • Know evacuation routes and assembly points for your venue
  • Practice evacuation procedures with participants
  • Maintain current emergency contact lists
  • Have mobile phone charged and accessible
  • Know location of emergency equipment and supplies

Critical Incident Reporting

Immediate Reporting Required For:

  • Any injury requiring medical attention
  • Allegations of abuse or neglect
  • Significant behavioral incidents
  • Property damage or security breaches
  • Missing persons or unauthorized departures
📞 Emergency Contacts

Emergency Services: 000
Malaika House Emergency Line: 1800-MALAIKA
After Hours Supervisor: 0400-XXX-XXX
Safeguarding Officer: safeguarding@malaikahouse.org
